Package com.andreamazzon.session5.interfaceexample

In this package we illustrate a first example of interface: and interface is a "completely abstract" class, as it only gives the returning type, name and arguments lists of the methods that a class "implementing" that interface must implement, and possibly static fields: it provides the "form" of a class implementing that interface, but not the implementation.
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Cure
    This interface has two methods: diagnose() and cure().
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Antivirus
    This class implements the interface Cure, and it gives indeed an implementation to the two methods defined in Cure.
    Doctor
    This class implements the interface Cure, as it gives an implementation to the two methods defined in Cure.
    Healing
    This class illustrates how upcasting and polymorphism work also with interfaces. it has a method which takes as an argument an object of any class implementing Cure: the right implementation of the method is called at running time via late binding.
